xxl.core.functions
Class Functions

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.Functions

public class Functions
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains some useful static methods for manipulating objects of type Function.

Method Detail

composeMulti

public static <P,R,T> Function<T,R> composeMulti(Function<P,R> g,
                                                 Function<? super T,? extends java.util.List<? extends P>> f)
This method declares a new function h by composing a given function g with a function f.

Note that the method does not execute the code of the new function h. The invocation of the composed function h is just triggered by a call of its own invoke-method. Then, the input parameters are passed to each given function f, and the returned objects are used as the input parameters of the function g. The invoke method of h returns the final result.

Type Parameters:
P - the return type of the inner function and the type of the outer function's parameters.
R - the return type of the outer function, i.e., the return type of the composed function.
T - the type of the inner function's parameters, i.e., the type of the composed function's parameters.
Parameters:
g - the outer function to be composed.
f - the inner function to be composed.
Returns:
the result of the composition.

compose

public static <P,R,T> Function<T,R> compose(Function<P,R> g,
                                            Function<? super T,? extends P>... f)
This method declares a new function h by composing a given function g with a number of functions f_1,...,f_n.

Note that the method does not execute the code of the new function h. The invocation of the composed function h is just triggered by a call of its own invoke-method. Then, the input parameters are passed to each given function f_1,...,f_n, and the returned objects are used as the input parameters of the new function g. The invoke method of h returns the final result.

Type Parameters:
P - the return type of the inner functions and the type of the outer function's parameters.
R - the return type of the outer function, i.e., the return type of the composed function.
T - the type of the inner functions' parameters, i.e., the type of the composed function's parameters.
Parameters:
g - the outer function to be composed.
f - the inner functions to be composed.
Returns:
the result of the composition.

returnFirst

public static <P,R> R returnFirst(Function<? super P,? extends R> function,
                                  java.util.Iterator<? extends P>... iterators)
                     throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
Returns the first function value (function takes m arguments).

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the given function's parameters.
R - the return type of the given function.
Parameters:
iterators - iterators holding the arguments to the function. The number of iterators should correspond to the number of arguments of the function.
function - the function to invoke.
Returns:
the first function value.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the given iterators do not deliver the necessary number of objects.

public static <P,R> R returnLast(Function<? super P,? extends R> function,
                                 java.util.Iterator<? extends P>... iterators)
                    throws java.util.NoSuchElementException

Type Parameters:

R - the return type of the given function.
Parameters:
iterators - iterators holding the arguments to the function. The number of iterators should correspond to the number of arguments of the function.
function - the function to invoke.
Returns:
the last function value.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the given iterators do not deliver the necessary number of objects.

returnNth

public static <P,R> R returnNth(int n,
                                Function<? super P,? extends R> function,
                                java.util.Iterator<? extends P>... iterators)
                   throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
Returns the n-th function value (function takes m arguments).

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the given function's parameters.
R - the return type of the given function.
Parameters:
n - the number of the returned value.
iterators - iterators holding the arguments to the function. The number of iterators should correspond to the number of arguments of the function.
function - the function to invoke.
Returns:
the n-th function value.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the given iterators do not deliver the necessary number of objects.

aggregateUnaryFunction

public static <P,R> Function<P,R> aggregateUnaryFunction(AggregationFunction<P,R> aggregateFunction)
Wraps an aggregation function to a unary function by storing the status of the aggregation internally.

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the function's parameters.
R - the return type of the function.
Parameters:
aggregateFunction - aggregation function to provide as an unary function
Returns:
an unary function wrapping an aggregation function

abs

public static Function<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Double> abs()
Returns an one-dimensional real-valued function providing an absolute of a number. The result of the mathematical operation will be returned by a double number!

Returns:
a Function performing an absolute of numerical data.

hash

public static Function<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Integer> hash()
Returns the hash-value of the given object wrapped to an Integer instance. Note, this implementation delivers an unary function. Do not apply to none, two or more parameters.

Returns:
the hash-value of the given object.

printlnMapFunction

public static <T> Function<T,T> printlnMapFunction(java.io.PrintStream ps)
This method returns a function which is the identity function with the side effect of sending the object to a PrintStream.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the objects the returned function is able to process.
Parameters:
ps - PrintStream to which the object is sent.
Returns:
the desired function.

printlnDecoratorFunction

public static <P,R> Function<P,R> printlnDecoratorFunction(Function<? super P,? extends R> f,
                                                           java.io.PrintStream ps,
                                                           boolean showArgs,
                                                           java.lang.String beforeArgs,
                                                           java.lang.String argDelimiter,
                                                           java.lang.String beforeResultDelimiter,
                                                           java.lang.String afterResultDelimiter)
This method returns a function which is the identity function with the side effect of sending the object to a PrintStream.

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the given function's parameters.
R - the return type of the given function.
Parameters:
f - Function to be decorated.
ps - PrintStream to which the object is sent.
showArgs - showing the arguments which are sent to the Function? (yes/no).
beforeArgs - String which is printed at first (before writing the arguments).
argDelimiter - String which delimits the arguments from each other.
beforeResultDelimiter - String which is places between the last argument (if this is printed) and the rest.
afterResultDelimiter - String which is printed after the result (at the end).
Returns:
the desired function

comparatorTestMapFunction

public static <T> Function<T,T> comparatorTestMapFunction(java.util.Comparator<? super T> c,
                                                          boolean ascending)
This method returns a function which is the identity function with an additional test. If the objects of subsequent invoke-calls do not adhere to the given comparator, a runtime exception is sent.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the objects the returned function is able to process.
Parameters:
c - the comparator.
ascending - true iff the order is ascending, else false.
Returns:
the desired function.

newNullSensitiveFunction

public static <P,R> Function<P,R> newNullSensitiveFunction(Function<? super P,? extends R> function,
                                                           R defaultValue)
Makes a given function able to handle null values. The defaultValue is the return value of the function if one of the parameters is a null value. If no null value is handed over the given function is called.

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the functions's parameters.
R - the return type of the given function.
Parameters:
function - the given function.
defaultValue - the default value.
Returns:
the function able to handle null values.

select

public static <T> Function<T,T> select(int index)
Returns a function the selects to indexth argument of its input parameters and returns it.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the function's parameters and result.
Parameters:
index - the index of the argument to be returned.
Returns:
a function the selects to indexth argument of its input parameters and returns it.
